constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LASC Name: Local Area of Special Character

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Variation of Condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of Planning permission Ref.: 18/12413/HOU (Erection of two storey side extension, installation of rear bay windows and balconies at ground and first floor, enlargement of basement and erection of front lightwell) to revise the rear bay roofs, from pitched hipped roofs to flat with parapets.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents: Drawings and Documents submitted with this application 19/02119/FUL197 PR P EN Rev 'G' - Elevation North - PROPOSED197 PR P ER Rev 'G' - Elevation Rear - PROPOSED197 PR P ES Rev 'G' - Elevation South - PROPOSED197 PR P EN P1R Rev 'G' - Plans First Floor and Roof - PROPOSEDDrawings and Documents approved under and carried forward from 18/12413/HOU:Planning Statement 20/17/2018Basement Impact Assessment 20/07/2018Construction Method Statement 20/07/2018Location Plan 1:1250197 PR P EF Rev 'B' Proposed Elevation Front (July 2018)197 PR P PBG Rev 'B' Proposed Basement and  Ground Floors (July 2018)Reason:  For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The materials and finishes of the external walls and roof of thedevelopment hereby permitted shall match in colour and texture those ofthe existing building, or such other materials as shall have beenapproved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and shall thereafterbe retained as such.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of thedevelopment in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements forNew Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF CoreStrategy Adopted April 2012.

Before beneficial use of the balconies (ground, first and second floors)hereby permitted, details of the privacy screen(s) along the side edgesof the balconies shall be submitted and approved in writing by the LocalPlanning Authority. The privacy screen(s) shall be installed prior tobeneficial use and shall thereafter be retained as such.Reason: In order to ensure the privacy and visual amenity of adjoiningoccupiers is retained in accordance with Policy DM10 (DesignRequirements for New Developments including House Extensions) ofthe LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Before any occupation of the two storey side extension herebypermitted, the windows in the south side elevation and situated on theground floor, shall be constructed so that no part of the framework lessthan 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part belowthat level shall be fitted with, and retained in, obscure glazing of apatterned type only which shall thereafter be retained as such.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of theadjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (DesignRequirements for New Developments including House Extensions) ofthe LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning(General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Orderrevoking or re-enacting this Order) no windows or other openings (otherthan those hereby approved) shall be formed in the south side elevationwall of the extension hereby approved without the prior written consentof the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of theadjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (DesignRequirements for New Developments including House Extensions) ofthe LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The extensions hereby permitted shall be occupied solely for purposesincidental to the occupation and enjoyment of the application propertyas a single dwelling and shall not be used as a separate unit ofaccommodation.Reason: The establishment of an additional independent unit ofaccommodation would give rise to an over-intensive use of the site andlead to an unsatisfactory relationship between independent dwellings.

The flat roofs to the bay windows hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes. Only those areas identified as balconies and terraces on the approved drawings shall be used for such purposes. Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Your attention is drawn to the fact that planning permission does not override property rights and any ancient rights of light that may exist. This permission does not empower you to enter onto land not in your ownership without the specific consent of the owner. If you require further information or advice, you should consult a solicitor.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation. These cover such works as - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works. Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts. A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Reasonable efforts have been made to check that the plans submitted for the purposes of this planning application are consistent from one to the next, and that the development hereby approved can be implemented in accordance with all of the plans submitted. Should it transpire that this is not possible and that your plans are flawed, please be clear that it may be impossible to implement this permission, and that any development undertaken which relies on this permission may be unauthorised and subject to enforcement action.

When undertaking demolition and/or noisy building work, please be considerate to your neighbours and do not undertake work before 8am or after 6pm Monday to Friday, before 8am or after 1pm on a Saturday or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays. You are advised that the Council does have formal powers to control noise and nuisance under The Control of Pollution Act 1974, the Clean Air Acts and other relevant legislation, and that any works undertaken which impact unreasonably upon the surrounding area may be subject to action by the Council's Environmental Health Department.

Section 59 of the Highways Act permits the Highway Authority to charge developers for damage caused by excessive weight and movements of vehicles to and from a site. The Highway Authority will pass on the cost of any excess repairs compared to normal maintenance costs to the applicant/organisation responsible for the damage.

The developer is reminded that it is an offence to allow materials to be carried from the site and deposited on or damage the highway from uncleaned wheels or badly loaded vehicles. The Highway Authority will seek, wherever possible, to recover any expenses incurred in clearing, cleaning or repairing highway surfaces and prosecute persistent offenders. (Highways Act 1980 Sections 131, 148, 149).

Your attention is drawn to the fact that planning permission does not override property rights and any ancient rights of light that may exist. This permission does not empower you to enter onto land not in your ownership without the specific consent of the owner. If you require further information or advice, you should consult a solicitor.
Please can you advise which condition you are looking to remove as this is not clear from your application form recently submitted.
Please clearly mark your submitted plans as ones which have been previously submitted and approved, and ones which are now showing the proposed changes

Please be advised we are able to confirm that the submitted drawings were received at the earlier date, however we have subsequently written to you advising that a Full Planning Application would also be required when dealing with the Listed Building Consent application

Please be advised that a fee of £407 is required for this application as the works are to more than one residential dwelling. The balance, £173, can be paid either online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Service Team on 020 8547 5002

Please be advised that if you are seeking to make an application to Vary a condition (2 Approved Plans), then an application for a Variation of Condition (Section 73) is required to be submitted. As per your application you are seeking to replace a previously approved drawing with another
Please amend application form, section 5, to show both householder and listed building application reference numbers and return a copy to this office as soon as possible.

Please confirm description of proposed works "Non Material Amendment to Planning Permission 18/16321/HOU and Listed Building Consent  18/16324/LBC (Demolition of existing garage and carport. Erection of single storey front extension and formation of a frameless glass link between the house and the new extension and erection of single storey detached garage) to reduce the scale of store for use as a Utility Room, change of materials  and design of elevations, addition of new store adjacent to new garage and removal of  internal walls and relocation of garage rooflight."
